# Introduction

@fama1973risk : Two-parameter risk-return regression equation is based on Equation \ref{Equation:BlackScholes1972}: 

```{=tex}
\begin{align}
    &x_{im}  \equiv \frac{\text{total market value of all units of assets} \ i}{\text{total market value of all assets}} \\
    &\text{where asset} (i) \text{in the portfolio} (m) \nonumber
\end{align}
\label{Equation:BlackScholes1972}
```
Equation \ref{Equation:BlackScholes1972} refers to the market equilibrium (market portflio) is always efficient (@black1972capital).

Excepted Return is given by Equation \ref{Equation:ExpectedReturnFama1953}, $\beta_i$ is the risk of the asset $i$ of the portfolio $m$, measured relative to $\sigma^{2}(\tilde{R}_m)$


```{=tex}
\begin{align}
    &E(\tilde{R_i}) = \left[E(\tilde{R_m}) -S_m \sigma(\tilde{R_m} ) \right] + S_m \sigma (\tilde{R_m}) \beta_i,\\
    &\text{where}, \\ \nonumber
    &\beta_i \equiv \frac{cov(\tilde{R_i}, \tilde{R_m})}{\sigma^2(\tilde{R_m})} = \frac{\sigma_{j=1}^{N} x_{jm}\sigma_{ij}}{\sigma^2 (\tilde{R_m})}=\frac{cov(\tilde{R_i},\tilde{R_m})\sigma(\tilde{R_m})}{\sigma (\tilde{R_m})} \nonumber \\
    &S_m=\frac{E(\tilde{R_m})-E(\tilde{R_0})}{\sigma (\tilde{R_m})} \\ \nonumber
    &\text{hence} \nonumber
    E(\tilde{R_i}) = E(\tilde{R_0}) + \left[ E(\tilde{R_m}) - E(\tilde{R_0}) \right] \beta_i
\end{align}
\label{Equation:ExpectedReturnFama1953}
```

Hence, Equation \ref{Equation:ExpectedReturnFama1953} refers that expected return on security $i$ is $E(\tilde{R_0})$, the expected return on a security that is riskless in the portfolio $m$, plus a risk premium that is $\beta_i$ times the difference between $E(\tilde{R_m})$ and $E(\tilde{R_0})$

For each period of $t$, the cross sectional regression is given by 

```{=tex}
\begin{align}
    & R_{pt} = \tilde{\gamma}_{0t} + \tilde{\gamma}_{1t} \tilde{\beta}_{p,t-1}+\tilde{\gamma}_{2t} \tilde{\beta}_{p,t-1}^{2} + \tilde{\gamma}_{3t} \bar{s}_{p, t-1} \tilde{\epsilon}_{i}+\tilde{\eta}_{pt}, \\
    &p=1,2,...t \nonumber
\end{align}
\label{Equation:ExpectedReturnFama1953EquationTen}
```

In Equation \ref{Equation:ExpectedReturnFama1953EquationTen} the indepenent variable $\tilde{\beta}_{p,t-1}$ is the average of the $\tilde{\beta}_i$ for securities in portfolio $p$, $\tilde{\beta}_{p,t-1}^2$ is the average of the squared values of these $\tilde{\beta}_i$, $\bar{s}_{p, t-1} \tilde{\epsilon}_{i}$ is the average of $s\tilde{\epsilon}_i$ for portfolio $p_i$
